actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to Subcommittee on Livestock, Dairy, and Poultry.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Livestock, Dairy and Poultry

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Meat Inspection Act to require that imported meat and meat food products be subject to certain examination, inspection, and labeling requirements, and to require the Secretary to issue a study of the feasibility of requiring eating establishments serving imported meat or meat food products to provide notice of that fact to their customers.
short_title: Federal Meat Import Labeling Act of 1985

summary.text: Federal Meat Import Labeling Act of 1985 - Amends the Federal Meat Inspection Act to require imported meat to be labeled with its country of origin and to be examined and inspected at the port of entry. Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to assess fees to cover costs. Requires the Secretary to study and report to the Congress on the feasibility of requiring eating establishments to inform customers that imported meat is being served.

titles.title: Federal Meat Import Labeling Act of 1985

A bill to amend the Federal Meat Inspection Act to require that imported meat and meat food products be subject to certain examination, inspection, and labeling requirements, and to require the Secretary to issue a study of the feasibility of requiring eating establishments serving imported meat or meat food products to provide notice of that fact to their customers.
